intro: Pavetta cataractarum var. hirtiflora, commonly known as the hairy-flowered pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with showy flowers and aromatic leaves. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pinkish flowers and hairy stems and leaves, giving it a distinctive appearance. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as forest understories or along riverbanks. The leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
